Recipe.title: Sugar-Free Gummy Treats
Recipe.Description: This recipe is tasty, and very easy to make, but the best part is: it's fat-free and carbohydrate-free!!!

section.instruction: Put Gelatin into a small mixing bowl.
Carefully, pour Boiling Water into the small mixing bowl.
Stir until powder is completely dissolved.

Pour mixture into molds.
Hint: If you lightly spray the molds with non-stick spray (such as Pam) then the treats are easier to remove when done.
Refridgerate until firm. (This only takes about an hour.)
Remove from the molds and enjoy!

Notes.note:
In Step 3, if you add the powder directly into the Boiling Water, it may "flash boil".
This will cause it to spray all over and somebody usually gets burned.
(Believe me, I learned the hard way!)

In Step 5, we use molds for "Jello Jigglers" that are about the size of jelly beans. We have also seen some cool candy molds that would work well.
If you don't have molds, you can pour the mixure into a 8" × 8" pan, then cut it into strips after it sets.

Modifications.modification:
To make the treats less tart:
Replace one of the packages of Sugar-free flavored Gelatin with one envelope (7g) unflavored Gelatin (Such as Knox)

To make the treats extra tart:
Add 1 0.13oz. Envelope unsweetened Soft Drink Mix (Such as Kool-Aid)

To make the treats sweeter and more flavorful:
Add 1 1.7g. Package Sugar-free Soft Drink Mix (Such as Crystal Light)
